triples.name: Customer attrition
triples.relevance: The paper addresses predicting customer churn/attrition in the banking sector, which is the core business problem being solved.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning forms the foundational methodology for building the customer churn prediction models discussed throughout the paper.

triples.name: Sampling (statistics)
triples.relevance: The paper uses sampling techniques to balance data for improved model training and predictive performance.

triples.name: XGBoost
triples.relevance: XGBoost is the optimal machine learning model proposed and used to achieve 97% accuracy in customer churn prediction.

triples.name: Shapley value
triples.relevance: SHAP (Shapley Additive exPlanations) values are used to interpret the XGBoost model and analyze feature importance for customer churn.

triples.name: Causal inference
triples.relevance: Causal inference methodology, specifically the R-learner method, is used to determine the causal impacts of variables on customer churn.
